input:
Arsenal 2 - 2 Paris

First Half:

00:00 Event: Kick-off by Arsenal
02:08 Event: Ball out of play

10:35 Caption: Some great controlled play and passing from Paris SG. They are increasing their possession of the ball and trying to open up the opposition's defence to hit them swiftly on the break.
11:15 Event: Ball out of play
11:17 Caption: Lucas Moura (Paris SG) tries to latch onto a through ball, but it's too long. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Arsenal.

13:19 Caption: Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge.
14:12 Event: Ball out of play
14:15 Caption: Thomas Meunier (Paris SG) sends a pass into the box, but his attempt is thwarted and cleared. The ball is out of play and Paris SG manage to earn a corner.
14:32 Caption: Lucas (Paris SG) will deliver the corner kick.
14:41 Event: Corner by Paris
14:43 Event: Shots on target by Paris
14:48 Caption: Edinson Cavani (Paris SG) meets a cross and produces a header towards the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players blocks the effort.
15:23 Event: Ball out of play
15:40 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
16:08 Caption: Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) attempts to find one of his teammates with a fine lofted pass, but the defence reacts well to intercept the effort.
17:47 Event: Shots on target by Paris
17:48 Event: Goal by Paris
18:00 Caption: It's in the back of the net! Blaise Matuidi is the provider as he slips the ball to Edinson Cavani (Paris SG) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 0:1.
18:49 Event: Kick-off by Arsenal
19:13 Event: Ball out of play
19:27 Caption: Edinson Cavani (Paris SG) produces a poor pass. He attempts to get the ball into the box but it's hacked away. Paris SG force a corner. They send men into the box.
19:42 Event: Corner by Paris
19:42 Caption: The ball is whipped in from the corner by Lucas (Paris SG), but one of the defenders gets it clear.
19:52 Event: Shots on target by Paris
20:38 Event: Foul by Arsenal
20:43 Caption: Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) tackles a bit over-zealously and Felix Brych blows for a foul. Paris SG win a free kick.
20:46 Event: Indirect free-kick by Paris
20:47 Event: Ball out of play
20:54 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
21:35 Event: Ball out of play
21:39 Caption: Carl Jenkinson (Arsenal) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. The ball has crossed the sideline. Paris SG are taking a throw-in.
21:56 Event: Throw-in by Paris
22:35 Event: Offside by Arsenal
22:39 Caption: The linesman signals that Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) is offside and the referee confirms the decision.
23:05 Event: Indirect free-kick by Paris
23:58 Event: Ball out of play
24:02 Caption: The ball is cleared after Maxwell (Paris SG) attempted to dribble past an opposing player. The ball goes out of play and Arsenal will have a goal kick.
24:24 Event: Clearance by Arsenal
24:37 Event: Ball out of play
24:42 Caption: Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) delivers a low pass into the box which is intercepted. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Paris SG.
25:27 Event: Clearance by Paris
25:39 Event: Ball out of play
25:51 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
26:12 Event: Offside by Paris
26:17 Caption: Edinson Cavani (Paris SG) fails to beat a perfect example of the offside trap.
26:19 Event: Indirect free-kick by Arsenal
26:43 Caption: Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) sends a chip pass into the box, but Alphonse Areola is quickest to intercept the ball.
27:38 Event: Ball out of play
27:43 Caption: Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge. The ball goes out of play and Paris SG will have a goal kick.
28:06 Event: Clearance by Paris

28:59 Event: Ball out of play

29:22 Caption: Carl Jenkinson (Arsenal) attempts to slip the ball through the defence, but is unable to find any of his teammates.
30:06 Event: Ball out of play

33:58 Caption: Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
34:16 Event: Indirect free-kick by Paris
34:50 Event: Ball out of play
34:54 Caption: Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) sends a long ball across the pitch, but it misses its target. The ball goes out of play and Paris SG will have a goal kick.
35:17 Event: Clearance by Paris
35:57 Event: Ball out of play

36:20 Event: Ball out of play
36:28 Event: Throw-in by Paris
36:32 Event: Ball out of play
36:47 Event: Throw-in by Paris
37:13 Caption: Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) and Olivier Giroud exchange crossfield passes in an attempt to shake up the opposition's defence, but the last pass is not up to the mark and is stolen by the defender. Well read.
37:21 Event: Foul by Arsenal
37:35 Event: Indirect free-kick by Paris
38:00 Event: Ball out of play
38:13 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal

38:53 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal

39:34 Caption: Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) slides a pass forward, but one of the defenders cuts it out. Arsenal win a corner.
39:46 Caption: Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) rolls the ball short to a teammate from the corner instead of sending a cross into the box.
39:54 Event: Corner by Arsenal

41:13 Event: Clearance by Paris
41:16 Event: Ball out of play
41:24 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
41:40 Event: Ball out of play
41:43 Caption: Carl Jenkinson (Arsenal) is disappointed with himself because he got into a good area but produced a poor cross. The ball goes out of play and Paris SG will have a goal kick.
42:03 Event: Clearance by Paris
42:39 Event: Shots on target by Arsenal
42:44 Caption: Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) sends a teasing cross into the area, but Alphonse Areola intercepts the ball.
42:57 Event: Ball out of play
43:01 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
44:15 Event: Foul by Paris
44:29 Caption: Grzegorz Krychowiak (Paris SG) brings an opponent down and Felix Brych interrupts the game. A penalty is given to Arsenal!
45:41 Event: Penalty by Arsenal
45:41 Event: Shots on target by Arsenal
45:42 Event: Goal by Arsenal
45:42 Caption: Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
45:47 Caption: Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) scores from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner to give the goalkeeper no chance!
46:28 Caption: The match has reached half-time.
46:59 Caption: We are watching a run-of-the-mill game with only a few moments to ignite the crowd. The players surely can surely perform better, they just need to motivate themselves. The visitors dominated that half and looked more dangerous in attack. The home side are really focusing on a well-organized defence and are happy to let the opposition play their possession football.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Paris
00:01 Caption: The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
00:20 Event: Offside by Arsenal
00:28 Caption: The linesman raises his flag. Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) is adjudged offside.
00:52 Event: Indirect free-kick by Paris
01:17 Event: Foul by Arsenal
01:25 Caption: Poor challenge! Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) is penalised for tripping and Felix Brych blows his whistle. A free kick has been awarded to Paris SG.
01:40 Event: Indirect free-kick by Paris
02:14 Event: Foul by Paris
02:20 Event: Indirect free-kick by Arsenal
02:21 Caption: Lucas (Paris SG) brings down his opponent with a very late tackle. It's a free kick to Arsenal, but they probably won't attempt a direct shot on goal from here.
02:40 Event: Ball out of play

02:52 Event: Ball out of play

05:53 Caption: Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) produces a lovely chip pass into the box, but one of the opposition players cuts it out.
06:54 Event: Foul by Arsenal
07:03 Event: Yellow card by Arsenal

08:08 Event: Direct free-kick by Paris
08:08 Event: Shots off target by Paris
08:09 Event: Ball out of play
08:16 Caption: Lucas (Paris SG) takes a mid-range free kick and his stunning strike crashes against the crossbar.
08:31 Event: Clearance by Arsenal

11:09 Event: Shots on target by Paris
11:27 Caption: Edinson Cavani (Paris SG) creates himself some space on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot which is blocked by a defender.
11:49 Event: Shots off target by Arsenal

12:04 Event: Ball out of play
12:11 Caption: Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Arsenal will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
12:23 Caption: Corner kick. Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) is ready to send the ball into the box.
12:33 Event: Corner by Arsenal
12:43 Event: Ball out of play

12:59 Caption: Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) lifts the ball into the box from the corner, but one of the defending players gets there first to head it clear.
13:05 Event: Corner by Arsenal

13:59 Event: Goal by Arsenal
14:00 Caption: Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked.
14:26 Caption: Marco Verratti (Paris SG) puts the ball into the back of the net but, unfortunately for him and his teammates, it's into his own goal!
14:55 Event: Kick-off by Paris
15:16 Event: Ball out of play

16:57 Event: Ball out of play
17:01 Caption: Edinson Cavani (Paris SG) unleashes a shot from 20 metres out but is unable to find the target and it goes well wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Arsenal will have a goal kick.
17:26 Event: Clearance by Arsenal
17:45 Caption: Edinson Cavani (Paris SG) dribbles into the box, but David Ospina is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.

19:50 Event: Ball out of play

26:23 Event: Ball out of play

31:52 Event: Substitution by Arsenal

35:48 Event: Throw-in by Arsenal
36:31 Event: Shots off target by Paris

36:37 Caption: What a chance that is! Lucas swings the ball into the box, and Edinson Cavani (Paris SG) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the left post.
37:12 Event: Clearance by Arsenal
37:56 Event: Offside by Arsenal
38:01 Caption: Flag goes up against Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) and the referee blows his whistle for offside.
38:26 Event: Indirect free-kick by Paris
39:13 Event: Foul by Arsenal
39:20 Caption: Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) is penalised for holding. Felix Brych signals a set piece.
39:40 Event: Indirect free-kick by Paris

40:11 Event: Indirect free-kick by Arsenal
40:16 Event: Ball out of play
40:55 Event: Throw-in by Paris
42:24 Caption: Thomas Meunier (Paris SG) swings a cross into the box, but it's far too close to David Ospina, who smothers the ball.
42:30 Event: Ball out of play
42:59 Event: Substitution by Paris
43:07 Event: Throw-in by Paris
43:14 Caption: It's time for a substitution. Jese (Paris SG) comes on in place of Lucas.
43:37 Event: Shots on target by Paris
43:43 Caption: Jese (Paris SG) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the box but his shot is blocked.
44:03 Event: Ball out of play
44:14 Event: Throw-in by Paris
45:47 Caption: The defence had a hard time blocking out the strike from Jese (Paris SG). He didn't hesitate and finished from outside the box right after he had received a pass from his teammate. Paris SG force their opponents to concede a corner.
45:56 Caption: Hatem Ben Arfa (Paris SG) works the corner short instead of sending the ball into the penalty area.
46:27 Caption: Thiago Motta (Paris SG) fails to pick a body out in the box with an over-hit chip pass. The ball goes out of play and Arsenal will have a goal kick.
48:10 Caption: That's it for today, Felix Brych has blown his whistle and the game is over.
48:59 Caption: There was no time for the supporters to get bored during the game as it was full of action and thrilling moments. The performance of both teams was pretty much even. Both teams attempted to play possession football.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In what turned out to be an engrossing encounter at the Emirates Stadium, Arsenal and Paris Saint-Germain played out a thrilling 2-2 draw that left both sets of fans entertained from start to finish.

The game began with Arsenal taking the kick-off, immediately putting Paris SG on alert. Within the early minutes, the ball found itself out of play multiple times as both teams wrestled to gain control. Paris SG had a promising start as Lucas Moura tried to latch onto a through ball early on but was unsuccessful. This was soon followed by a scare for Arsenal as Alexis Sanchez struggled to connect accurately with Mesut Ozil down the pitch. 

Paris SG enjoyed a spell of dominance around the 10-minute mark with controlled play and precision passing. They were rewarding their possessive style when Blaise Matuidi laid the ball off for Edinson Cavani, who made no mistake from close range to slot home for Paris, putting the visitors ahead 1-0 in the 18th minute. Arsenal's attempts to hit back were continually thwarted by a resolute Parisian defence. The first half saw plenty of intense tackles which resulted in a couple of yellow cards, first for Paris's Marquinhos and then for Arsenal’s Francis Coquelin. 

Despite striving to find the back of the net, neither team could dominate the game completely as every promising move seemed to end in another formal clearance or a cautious play that reset the attack. As the clock neared half time, Arsenal found themselves gifted a golden opportunity. Grzegorz Krychowiak brought down an Arsenal player in the box, and Felix Brych did not hesitate to point to the spot. Olivier Giroud stepped up to take the penalty and calmly converted it, sending Alphonse Areola the wrong way to ensure the Gunners ended the half on level terms.

After a half-time break that saw both teams regroup and plan their strategies, the second half kicked off with Paris SG again taking the initiative. However, almost immediately, Arsenal found themselves on the backfoot as Francis Coquelin was caught offside. Both teams pressed high in the subsequent minutes, trading fouls at regular intervals as Laurent Koscielny picked up another yellow for Arsenal, intensifying the stakes.

Paris came closest to regaining the lead in the 8th minute of the second half when Lucas struck a scintillating free kick that smacked against the crossbar. Arsenal's efforts to control possession saw them creating a number of chances, Alexis Sanchez delivering tantalizing crosses several times, ultimately finding Teammate Aaron Ramsey who fired at goal only to be blocked.

The decisive moment came just past the quarter-hour mark in the second half. In a moment of dismay, Marco Verratti, trying to intercept a cross, inadvertently turned the ball into his own net giving Arsenal the lead. The atmosphere within the Emirates shifted dramatically as the home supporters found their voices. 

Not to be undone, Paris SG immediately initiated a series of counter-attacks. Edinson Cavani remained a persistent threat throughout the game, his well-timed runs kept the Arsenal defenders alert. David Ospina denied Cavani time and again, coming off his line to snatch the ball away.

Tactical adjustments soon ensued as Arsenal looked to maintain their lead. Arsene Wenger introduced Granit Xhaka and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain to bolster the midfield. Theo Walcott also entered the fray replacing Francis Coquelin, demonstrating Arsenal’s intent to push for a third goal to seal the game.

However, PSG restored parity in another dramatic twist. A corner taken by Hatem Ben Arfa saw Alex Iwobi unfortunately heading the ball into his own net. Jubilant Paris supporters celebrated ecstatically, and the tie was set for a thrilling finale.

In the dying moments, both sides showed their resilience and composure. Giroud and Ramsey missed opportunities that could have clinched the game for Arsenal. On the other hand, Lucas Moura swung in a perfect cross that Edinson Cavani headed just wide of the left post, narrowly missing clinching victory for PSG.

Further substitutions from both teams saw fresh legs deployed in an attempt to tilt the balance. Jese joined the action for PSG, replacing Lucas Moura. Giroud remained a constant aerial threat, while Arsenal’s defensive lines weathered relentless pressure from the visiting side.

In the end, neither team could find the decisive third goal. Paris managed to take control of the ball in the dying minutes, but their efforts were in vain as Felix Brych blew three sharp whistles bringing the pulsating clash to a conclusion.

The full-time whistle marked the end of what had been a gripping battle, teeming with action and dramatic turnarounds. With numerous chances created and defencive efforts nullifying attacking threats, the game offered a snapshot of modern football’s blend of tactical discipline, individual flair, and the drama that make such contests immensely exciting.

This clash demonstrated the tenacity and strength in depth of both teams. Paris’s controlled ball possession and incisive play against Arsenal’s defensive discipline and counter-attacking prowess made for a highly engaging game. Credit goes to both teams for providing a spectacle filled with high-energy exchanges and moments of true footballing brilliance.

In summary, the 2-2 draw reflected a balanced encounter, promising fierce contests in future match-ups. While both teams will walk away with a point, their fans will no doubt reflect on what might have been, had one or two moments turned differently. This encounter at the Emirates Stadium will be remembered for its end-to-end action, the resilience of the under-pressure defences, and the sheer undying spirit displayed by both sides.
